secureLevel.title: The observations geographic information is public in detail

enumNames: Herb-rich forest with broadleaved deciduous trees
Mountain birch forest (excluding herb-rich mountain birch forest)
Graminoid dwarf shrub rock outcrop and scree
Rock outcrop and scree deficient of trees
Calcareous rock outcrop and quarry, bare calcareous land
Paljakan lähteikkö tai tihkupintaOroarctic/mountain spring complexes and habitats
Paljakan kallio tai kivikkoOroarctic/ rocky outcrop and scree
Paljakan järvi tai lampi (sis. ranta)Oroarctic/mountain lake
Paljakan virtavesi (sis. purot ja rannat)Oroarctic/mountain brookside or a stream
Rural biotopes and cultural habitats or other human-impacted environment
Roadsides (verges, banks, on the road etc.)
E - spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TE - alien, spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TVE - alien, resident, spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TOVE - alien, old, resident (archaeotype), cultivated origin
TNVE - alien, new, resident, cultivated origin
TNSE - alien, new, ephemeral, cultivated origin
H - short distance escape from cultivation (inside a garden or similar)
plantStatusCode.title: Plant status code

legPublic.ui:help: You can hide the observer names if needed by selecting "No". The observer names are always available to authoritatives.

editors.ui:help: If you report an identified user as an observer and the user has added you as a friend, you can give the user rights to edit this field trip report. Additionally observations from this field trip report are shown to this particular user among his/her own observations.

secureLevel.ui:help: By selecting "No" the observations geographic information will be coarsened to a 10 x 10 km² square in public material. The geographic information will always be available to authoritatives in detail. Images attached to coarsened observations are public.

ui:options.emptyHelp: Start reporting observations by drawing the observation site on the map
